001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
005import java.nio.file.Path;
006import java.util.function.Function;
007import java.util.stream.Stream;
008
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.OutputWriter.Writeable;
011
012/**
013 * This is the first stage of configuring a destination for export based on the
014 * specification of the data and the mappings to get the data from the outbreak
015 * class. This also defines the type of output (e.g. CSV) and initialisation of
016 * the output file in an output directory as appropriate.
017 *
018 * @param <X> the type of data to be exported, which must implement
019 *            CSVWriter.Writeable
020 */
021public class ExportSelector<X extends CSVWriter.Writeable> {
022        /**
023         * Factory method to create an ExportSelector for a given export type. This
024         * method takes a class type that extends CSVWriter.Writeable and is
025         * annotated with the Export annotation. It initializes the ExportSelector
026         * with the export configuration specified in the annotation, such as the
027         * export stage, filename, buffer size, and selector function. The created
028         * ExportSelector can then be used to set up the output writer and manage the
029         * export process for the specified data type.
030         *
031         * @param <X>  the type of data to be exported, which must implement
032         *             CSVWriter.Writeable
033         * @param type the class type of the export data, which should be annotated
034         *             with Export to provide configuration details for the export
035         *             process
036         * @throws RuntimeException if the provided class type does not have the
037         *                          required Export annotation or if there are issues
038         *                          with instantiating the selector function
039         *
040         * @return an instance of ExportSelector configured for the specified export
041         *         type, ready to be set up with an output writer and used for
042         *         exporting data during the simulation
043         *
044         */
045        public static <X extends CSVWriter.Writeable> ExportSelector<X> of(
046                        Class<X> type
047        ) {
048                return new ExportSelector<>(type);
049        }
050
051        private Export.Stage stage;
052        private Class<X> type;
053        private String filename;
054
055        private int size;
056        // TODO: Abstract CSVWriter and implement DuckDBWriter using appendable
057        // interface
058        // https://duckdb.org/docs/stable/clients/java.html#appender
059        // This will need to be configurable in the Export annotation.
060        private OutputWriter<X> writer;
061
062        private Function<Outbreak, Stream<? extends Writeable>> selector;
063
064        private ExportSelector(Class<X> type) {
065                Export.Stage stage = type.getAnnotation(Export.class).stage();
066                String file = type.getAnnotation(Export.class).value();
067                int size = type.getAnnotation(Export.class).size();
068                try {
069                        this.selector = type.getAnnotation(Export.class).selector()
070                                        .getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
071                } catch (Exception e) {
072                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
073                }
074                this.type = type;
075                this.filename = file;
076                this.size = size;
077                this.stage = stage;
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Initializes the output writer for the specified export type and sets up
082         * the output file in the given directory. This method is called after the
083         * ExportSelector is created to prepare the output destination for exporting
084         * data. The writer is instantiated based on the Export annotation's writer
085         * class, and the setup method is called to configure it with the export
086         * type, output file path, and buffer size.
087         *
088         * @param directory the path to the output directory where the export file
089         *                  will be created and configured
090         * @throws RuntimeException if there is an error during writer instantiation
091         *                          or setup, such as issues with file creation or
092         *                          reflection errors when accessing the writer class
093         *
094         */
095        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
096        public void finishSetup(Path directory) {
097                try {
098                        this.writer = this.type.getAnnotation(Export.class).writer()
099                                        .getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
100                        this.writer.setup(
101                                        this.type, directory.resolve(this.filename).toFile(), this.size
102                        );
103                } catch (IOException | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException
104                                | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException
105                                | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
106                        throw new RuntimeException(
107                                        "Couldn't setup exporter: " + directory.resolve(this.filename), e
108                        );
109                }
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * The stage of the outbreak simulation at which this export should be
114         * performed. This is determined by the Export annotation on the data type
115         * and is used to manage the timing of exports during the simulation
116         * execution. The stage indicates when the selector function should be
117         * applied to extract data from the outbreak and write it to the output file,
118         * allowing for proper sequencing of exports based on the simulation's
119         * lifecycle.
120         *
121         * @return the Export.Stage value indicating when this export should be
122         *         performed
123         */
124        public Export.Stage getStage() { return this.stage; }
125
126        /**
127         * The OutputWriter instance responsible for writing the exported data to the
128         * output file. This writer is configured based on the Export annotation's
129         * writer class and is set up with the appropriate output file path and
130         * buffer size. The getWriter method provides access to this writer for use
131         * during the export process, allowing the ExportSelector to manage the flow
132         * of data from the outbreak simulation to the output destination through the
133         * configured writer.
134         *
135         * @return the OutputWriter instance that has been initialized and set up for
136         *         writing exported data of type X to the output file
137         */
138        public OutputWriter<X> getWriter() { return this.writer; }
139
140        /**
141         * Applies the selector function to the given outbreak to retrieve a stream
142         * of data records that are ready to be exported. The selector function is
143         * defined in the Export annotation and is responsible for extracting the
144         * relevant data from the outbreak simulation and transforming it into a
145         * stream of Writeable records that can be written to the output file by the
146         * configured writer. This method is called during the export process to
147         * obtain the data to be exported for each simulation step, allowing the
148         * ExportSelector to manage the flow of data from the outbreak to the output
149         * destination.
150         *
151         * @param outbreak the outbreak simulation instance from which to extract the
152         *                 data for export; the selector function will use this
153         *                 outbreak to generate the stream of records to be exported
154         * @throws RuntimeException if there is an error during the application of
155         *                          the selector function, such as issues with data
156         *                          extraction from the outbreak or problems with the
157         *                          selector function's logic
158         *
159         * @return a stream of Writeable records generated by applying the selector
160         *         function to the given outbreak, which can then be written to the
161         *         output file by the configured writer
162         *
163         */
164        public Stream<? extends Writeable> selector(Outbreak outbreak) {
165                return this.selector.apply(outbreak);
166        }
167}
